factsheet.title: Cornwall & Isles of Scilly Growth Hub & Skills Hub
factsheet.description: Service offering a free, independent and impartial business review (subject to eligibility) with one of their senior connectors to help identify and access the right support for your business. The website holds resources including a local business directory and guidance information on regulation and environmental sustainability. Growth Hub members can have a free entry in the directory, share news and add events to the business calendar. For established businesses (with a focus on those with 5+ employees) the Skills Hub connects your business with training to upskill or expand your team, identifying areas of under-performance to fuel productivity and smarter working. Skills Connectors get to know your company and find cost effective training provision, workshops or recruitment solutions. The Skills Toolkit helps you undertake a business skills review and compile personalised templates for key HR policies and processes.

factsheet.title: Cornwall Council
factsheet.description: Signposting to organisations offering business support. Information and advice on business rates, licensing, environmental health, trading standards, planning, commercial premises, markets, street trading and procurement.

factsheet.title: Breakthrough: Start-up and Build
factsheet.eligibility: Most sectors are eligible, except professional services, healthcare, mining, farming, primary agricultural products and fishing.
factsheet.description: The programme offers an initial two-day workshop to help entrepreneurs challenge their own thinking and ensure the basics are in place.

factsheet.title: Outset Cornwall
factsheet.description: Offers 12-24 hours of specialist workshop or expert business coaching support to help you focus your ideas and then start, run and grow your own business.

factsheet.title: Invest in Cornwall (Cornwall Development Company)
factsheet.description: For businesses wishing to locate or re-locate to the Cornwall area through the Invest in Cornwall service*. Offer includes hosted visits to Cornwall with leading businesses, property searches, recruitment advice, industry insights, and access to market specialists.

factsheet.title: Business West
factsheet.description: Offer a range of business solutions, including mentoring, access to finance, digital hub resources, events and workshops, premises, exporting (including documentation), training and networking. Charges may apply.

factsheet.title: Unlocking Potential
factsheet.description: Delivers a range of services in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly. This includes business start-up support, business development, recruitment, graduate and professional jobs, networking events and mentoring. Run the Future Focus Programme which gives business leaders the tools, resources and networks to innovate and prosper. The programme consists of three main components: Future Focus Events, Future Focus Labs and Future Focus Resources.  Contact the programme organiser for further details on eligibility.

factsheet.title: Plymouth PatLib Centre
who: established SMEs looking for support with intellectual property.
factsheet.description: Services include:

factsheet.title: Acceleration through Innovation (ATI)
factsheet.eligibility: Ineligible sectors include: fishery and aquaculture, primary production, processing and marketing of agricultural products, coal, steel and shipbuilding sectors, synthetic fibres, generalised education, banking, accountants and insurance companies, medical, construction, hotels and accommodation and retail businesses.
factsheet.description: Provides intensive support to businesses who are ‘innovation ready’. Helps to bring new products/processes/services to market which drive up growth and productivity. Support includes initial diagnosis of needs, masterclasses, 1-2-1 and pop up clinics.

factsheet.title: Ehealth Productivity and Innovation in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly (EPIC)
factsheet.eligibility: Covers a range of technologies, including Apps, communication devices, websites, robotics and sensory/image based innovations that enhance health and social care provision.
factsheet.description: Offers one-to-one business support from specialists from the eHealth and digital sectors, webinars and support with applications to the £600,000 Challenge Fund. This includes access to experts in research areas critical for the development of eHealth products and services.

factsheet.title: Agri-tech Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
factsheet.description: Offers collaborative Research, Development and Innovation (RDI) projects with partner research institutions.  Grants – for projects from £2,500 to £25,000, providing funding towards consultancy costs, feasibility studies or to commission specialists. Graduate Placement programme – to help the business deliver an agreed RDI project – the programme can support the research and recruitment of the graduate, in addition to a salary subsidy of £1,500 (6 months) or £2,250 (9 months).  Businesses from any sector can apply so long as the research, development and innovation supports growth, productivity or market development in ‘Agri-tech’ i.e. the sector providing innovative goods and services for the agriculture, horticulture and food sectors. Agri-tech Cornwall & the Isles of Scilly is part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund.

factsheet.title: Access 2 Finance Cornwall
factsheet.eligibility: Ineligible sectors Professional services, Healthcare, Mining, Farming, Primary agricultural products, Fishing.
factsheet.description: Free programme aimed at businesses that wish to raise finance for their business, support is available through workshops and one-to-one support to help them access the right type of finance to meet their business needs.

factsheet.title: DIT South West (previously known as UKTI)
factsheet.description: Offer expert trade advice and practical support to UK-based companies wishing to export and grow their business overseas. They provide specialist support, advice and access to trade and investment events overseas. They help businesses to get ready to export. They help to increase the supply of inward investment opportunities and increase overseas demand for UK exports.

factsheet.title: Enterprise Europe Network (EEN) South West
factsheet.description: Connects innovators and other SMEs with potential partners overseas including manufacturers, distributors, co-developers and suppliers. Experts advise those looking to commercialise new ideas and succeed in new markets. EEN offers fully funded support to help you to access new markets; attend a wide variety of networking events and workshops; find sources of EU funding and finance such as Horizon 2020; learn about market and regulatory information (e.g. CE marking, product labelling); provide feedback concerning European Commission legislation.

factsheet.title: Innovate2Succeed - Business West
factsheet.eligibility: Subject to ERDF eligibility rules. Contact provider for details.
factsheet.description: Offers a fully funded programme which is designed to stimulate innovation, improve competitiveness and reduce the risks of launching a new product or service. Up to 7 days of one-to-one support from innovation specialists who will work with you to develop an action plan to overcome barriers to innovation and agree a bespoke package of modules to help you achieve and sustain business growth. The modules include entrepreneurship and innovation, business process and improvement techniques, access to finance, intellectual property, digital marketing, innovation in export etc. The programme is jointly funded by Innovate UK and the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF).

factsheet.title: Cornwall & Isles of Scilly Skills Hub
factsheet.description: The Skills Hub service, run by Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Growth Hub, connects your business to skills and training to upskill or expand your team, identify skills gaps or areas of under-performance to fuel productivity and smarter working.  Through a free, independent and impartial skills review for the business, the Skills Connectors get to know your company and use in-depth knowledge of the skills and training arena to find cost effective training provision, workshops or recruitment solutions.

factsheet.title: Local Manufacturing Advisory Programme (SWMAS)
factsheet.description: Support to develop capability and capacity to improve and grow. Support encompasses a free business review, strategy mapping, business coaching, supply chain engagement, workshops, events, and possible funding for consultancy and capital investment. In order to access the funding, the company must have a business bank account.

factsheet.title: Lawyers for your Business (LFYB)
factsheet.description: A scheme offering a free half-hour consultation with a member of the Law Society. The lawyer will not be able to deal with existing legal issues but can help with general legal enquiries about starting a business, employing people, contracts with customers and suppliers, taking on leased premises, business structures, health and safety and raising finance. When contacting a solicitor for a 30 minute free consultation you must advise you are calling regarding the Lawyers for your business scheme and use the named contact on the sheet sent to you from the service.

factsheet.title: Fredericks Foundation
factsheet.description: Business loan funding for people unable to access the finance they need from banks. You need to show that you have made a genuine application for funds to your bank or a mainstream lender and have been turned down. Loans available include Poor Credit Loans up to £16,000, Start up and Growth Revolving Loans up to £15,000 and Growth Company Revolving Loans up to £35,000. If your application is successful an administration fee is added to the loan, which is paid upfront. Fees are based on the size of the loan and start at 10% (minimum £500).

factsheet.title: Cornwall Community Foundation
factsheet.description: Small grants for local charities, community and voluntary groups based in Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly making a positive impact in their area. - conditions apply.

factsheet.title: SWIG Finance
factsheet.description: Provides a range of business loans to the South West for businesses at different stages and operating in different sectors. With finance sourced from both the public sector, via local authorities, European funds, central government and the private sector, SWIG invests loan finance from offices in Truro and Bristol into South West businesses which are either just starting up or seeking to grow and need funds to get things moving.

factsheet.title: Travel to Work Grant - Cornwall
factsheet.description: Funding to support sustainable travel measures at the workplace. Businesses can apply for a grant of a minimum of £100 per workplace. A minimum of 25% of the total cost must be met by the applicant (exclusive of any reclaimable VAT). Applications need to be supported by evidence that shows there is a need for the facilities/equipment (surveys, mileage, photographs). The grant can be used for the following: dedicated car share parking spaces, pool bikes or electric pool bikes, electric car charging points, showering / changing area facilities, remodelling car park layout, marked parking spaces, pedestrian routes and signage.

factsheet.title: Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Investment Fund
factsheet.eligibility: Excluded sectors - property development, ship building and agriculture. ERDF sector restrictions apply.
factsheet.description: Debt finance (£25,000 - £1million) and equity finance (£50,000 - £2 million) options, to start, scale-up and grow small businesses across the Cornwall and Isles of Scilly region. The scheme aims to overcome barriers to accessing finance for SMEs by providing access to start-up, early stage and development capital. Financial support is available towards a range of purposes including employing new staff, new machinery and equipment, exporting and premises expansion. It can also provide a capital injection to achieve ambitious growth plans through innovation. For all fund options you must be able to demonstrate growth potential.  To make an enquiry on the eligibility of your project, please see the scheme website.  It is part funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF)
